alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Kaibab Plateau; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 2:38AM MST until February 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 10 inches, see table below for site specific forecasts. Winds gusting 50 to 70 mph in the morning, decreasing to 40 to 55 mph in the afternoon. * WHERE...Areas near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Fredonia, Ganado, Heber-Overgaard, Jacob Lake, Pinetop-Lakeside, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Sedona, Seligman, Shonto, Show Low, Valle, Whiteriver, Williams and Window Rock. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. Additional snow forecast from 2 AM Today to 11 PM Today: Alpine 7 to 11 inches Buffalo Pass 5 to 9 inches Doney Park 3 to 5 inches Flagstaff 4 to 8 inches Forest Lakes 9 to 15 inches Fredonia 1 to 2 inches Ganado 2 to 4 inches Heber-Overgaard 4 to 6 inches Jacob Lake 6 to 10 inches Pinetop-Lkside 4 to 8 inches Prescott 2 to 4 inches Prescott Valley 0 to 1 inches Sedona 0 to 1 inches Seligman 0 to 1 inches Shonto 2 to 4 inches Show Low 4 to 6 inches Valle 1 to 3 inches Whiteriver 1 to 3 inches Williams 5 to 9 inches Window Rock 3 to 5 inches .
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
